applicability_reasoning: This regulation does not apply to the document for several key reasons: 1) The document is a pension life cover scheme rules document that outlines the operation of a company pension death benefit scheme. It does not deal with insurance rebates or rebate cheques which are the specific focus of Regulation 352. 2) The document describes a pure protection product administered by AIB Life as a pension scheme, not a general insurance product where rebates would typically apply. 3) There are no provisions or mentions in the document about rebates, refunds, or cheque processing to consumers. The only refund mentioned is related to excess proceeds being returned to employers, which is different from consumer rebates. 4) The scheme described is an occupational pension scheme governed primarily by pension legislation and Revenue rules, not general insurance consumer protection regulations about rebate processing.
regulation_text: 352. (1) Where an insurance intermediary has issued a rebate cheque to a consumer on behalf of an insurance undertaking, and the rebate cheque has not been presented for payment within 6 months from the date of issue, the insurance intermediary shall return the reb ate to the insurance undertaking. (2) Where a consumer requests from an insurance undertaking or insurance intermediary a rebate that has been returned to an insurance undertaking in accordance with paragraph (1), the requested insurance undertaking or insurance intermediary shall provide the rebate in accordance with Regulations 348, 349 and 351. Chapter 10 Claims processing
source_name: CENTRAL BANK (SUPERVISION AND ENFORCEMENT) ACT 2013 (SECTION 48) (CONSUMER PROTECTION) REGULATIONS 2025
